meanings.definition: The act of estimating or determining the worth or value of something.
meanings.sent1: Her valuation of the antique vase was based on its age and condition.
meanings.sent2: The valuation of the property was done by a professional appraiser.
meanings.sent3: During the game, the players had a fun competition to guess the valuation of each item.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, the valuation of a painting can be subjective and vary greatly.
meanings.sent5: The valuation of friendship cannot be measured in material possessions.

meanings.sent1: The valuation of the car was higher than expected due to its excellent condition.
meanings.sent2: Before selling the house, they needed to get an accurate valuation from a real estate agent.
meanings.sent3: At the charity auction, the valuation of the donated items surprised everyone with its generosity.
meanings.sent4: To some, the valuation of a person's worth is solely based on their financial success.
meanings.sent5: The valuation of the company's assets determined its overall financial health.

meanings.definition: An estimation or appraisal of the worth of something.
meanings.sent1: The valuation of the jewelry collection was challenging due to the unique pieces.
meanings.sent2: Before making a purchase, it's important to get a proper valuation of the item.
meanings.sent3: During the game show, contestants had to guess the valuation of various antiques.
meanings.sent4: The valuation of the house was crucial for the sellers to set a competitive price.
meanings.sent5: His valuation of her skills was evident in the glowing recommendation letter he wrote.
